channel.title: Posts on COMP6443 Musings
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on COMP6443 Musings

item.title: Same and Cross Origin Policy
item.description: Same-Origin Policy (SOP) Javascript code can only access data from the same origin (scheme + host + port) Very limited access to cross-origin sites (unless server is configured to allow)

item.title: XSS
item.description: Client Side Attacks XSS (Cross Site Scripting) Injection of malicious client-side code into the user’s browser.

item.title: Server Side Security
item.description: Server Side Security Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF) Make the server do something it’s not intended to.

item.title: Course CTF: Week 5
item.description: Letters Site: letters.

item.title: Flag Alert
item.description: Imagine doing a CTF challenge, and you’re trying to find a flag; but you don’t realise that you’ve found it already.

item.title: Course CTF: Week 4
item.description: Support Site: support.

item.title: Time Based Attacks
item.description: By timing how long it takes for a server to respond, we may be able to gain valuable information.

item.title: Injection
item.description: Injection Inserting arbitrary information that breaks the handling code in the server

item.title: Insecure Direct Object Reference
item.description: Finding resources by guessing their IDs

item.title: Role-Based Access Control
item.description: Horizontal Horizontal Control - Access other’s users data

item.title: CSRF - Cross-Site Request Forgery
item.description: Allows an attacker to make a user perform an action.

item.title: Attacking Web Apps
item.description: Website security assessment can be very daunting - there are so many different tools and technologies that you need to know, that it can often be overwhelming to find out where to start.

item.title: KB Proxy
item.description: Introduction KB Proxy is a Burp extension to access local-only sites through a tunnel endpoint.

item.title: Enumeration
item.description: Enumeration Enumeration is the process of finding sites/domains/locations that may be of interest

item.title: Threat Modeling
item.description: Threat modeling is a process by which potential threats, such as structural vulnerabilities, or the absence of appropriate safeguards can be identified, enumerated, and mitigations can be prioritised

item.title: Course CTF: DNS Recon
item.description: Useful Tools and Resources SecLists SecLists is a giant repository of useful word lists and payloads for use with various other tools!
